image.altText: protesters on the ground being pulled up by police

props.synopsis: Environmental action group Rising Tide staged a protest today calling for the federal government to end new coal and gas projects.

title.children: Police make 22 arrests at Parliament House during protest over coal and gas projects

image.altText: A digital ticketing system shows an error message

props.synopsis: Some commuters found they were unable to tap on and off their regular public transport routes this morning, with the ticket validator machines at some light rail stops displaying error messages.

title.children: MyWay+ system launches today amid hiccups

image.altText: Thousands of scarab beetles swarming outside a window at night.

props.synopsis: A run of hot weather is likely responsible for scarab beetles swarming some homes and business in the ACT region.

title.children: 'I thought it was raining': Swarms of beetles descend on Canberra homes

image.altText: Police Car

props.synopsis: All ACT households pay the $50 levy as part of their rates bills but an audit report has found there are problems with transparency when it comes to allocation of funds.

title.children: A spate of deaths led to a DV tax levy but an audit has found problems with it

image.altText: A man wearing a checked shirt standing in a vineyard.

props.synopsis: At Mount Majura Vineyard on the edge of Canberra, viticulturalist James Hopper is planting new grape varieties that can better cope with the effects of a changing climate.

title.children: Canberra winemakers planting new grape varieties that could become the wines of the future

image.altText: elderly woman wearing a red cardigan and sitting in an armchair in front of a pot with flowers, looking up at the camera

props.synopsis: Senior Constable Kristian White tasered 95-year-old Clare Nowland, but the decision to find him guilty of manslaughter was whether or not his actions were reasonably necessary.

title.children: It was never disputed a police officer tasered Clare Nowland, but the manslaughter decision is complex

image.altText: Six different hands reach towards a contactless pay point on public transport, each paying in a different way.

props.synopsis: A new ticketing system called MyWay+ will be introduced today for Canberra public transport, which allows users to tap on with certain contactless bank cards or by scanning a QR code in the new app.

title.children: Wondering how to use the new MyWay+ system? Here's what you need to know

image.altText: The exterior of a white marble court building.

props.synopsis: A Canberra corrections officer is denied bail after allegedly attacking a man through his car window, pulling him out of the window and further assaulting him, then attempting to run him over in a car.

title.children: Corrections officer allegedly attacked man and tried to run him down after weeks of threats, court hears

image.altText: A drone shot of a new housing estate, with houses stretching as far as the eye can see

props.synopsis: First home buyers should be able to borrow more money to get a home loan, according to a federal inquiry into home lending, which is expected to recommend the government ease restrictions on how much banks can lend out.

title.children: 'Stop penalising buyers': Inquiry to suggest it should be easier to get a home loan

image.altText: Two men sitting at a table, with flags behind them, looking on

props.synopsis: Arrest warrants were issued for Benjamin Netanyahu and his former defence minister, Yoav Gallant, as well as a Hamas military leader, last week.

title.children: Israeli PM to appeal International Criminal Court arrest warrant accusing him of war crimes

image.altText: A man and woman holding a photo of a woman

props.synopsis: Caitlin Wainrib's death in 2020 was ruled a suicide, but her family believe the police investigation failed to answer questions about her final days. Warning: This story contains references to suicide some audience members may find distressing.

title.children: A missing key, $2,000 and 'bizarre' text messages: The unresolved questions surrounding Caitlin's death

image.altText: Donald Trump and Matt Gaetz

props.synopsis: Among those targeted were the US president-elect's pick for US ambassador to the United Nations, and his former pick for attorney-general.

title.children: Trump cabinet picks targeted by bomb threats and 'swatting' attempts, FBI says

image.altText: Qantas takes delivery of A380 Airbus

props.synopsis: The safety regulator has lashed national carrier Qantas over a "cascade of errors" that saw a 1.25-metre tool left in an engine for 300 hours of flying time.

title.children: Qantas called out for process failures and 'cascade of errors' over 1.25m tool left in A380 engine

image.altText: a woman is sitting at a table looking at a utility bill.

props.synopsis: The Australian Energy Market Commission will crack down on 'concerning practices' by some energy providers amid the rollout of smart meters across the country.

title.children: In a big win for consumers, electricity retailers banned from switching households to 'surge' power prices

image.altText: A woman wearing a hat stands on a beach and looks out at the water.

props.synopsis: News of dangerous animal encounters tend to travel very fast in Australia, but the sometimes "racist" victim blaming that follows can compound the mental anguish of survivors.

title.children: Woman stung by blue-ringed octopus shocked by 'racist' victim blaming on social media

image.altText: A close up of a man's hand holding an obscured credit card while the other hand types on a laptop.

props.synopsis: With so many retailers spruiking big bargains this month, we're easy targets for fraudsters looking to cash in on the frenzied spending.

title.children: Black Friday sales are ramping up this week. So are scams

image.altText: A woman wearing yellow material wrapped around her head and upper body sits under a tent.

props.synopsis: The city of El Fasher, the capital of North Darfur in western Sudan, is at the centre of a devastating struggle between two warring factions. Humanitarian groups fear it could have catastrophic consequences.

title.children: A brutal paramilitary group is about to conquer a Sudanese city. Hundreds of thousands of people could die

image.altText: Medicinal cannabis plantations across open field outside with hills in the distance.

props.synopsis: The amount of money Australians are spending on medicinal cannabis continues to skyrocket, with new data showing this year's sales are on track to double those from 2023.

title.children: Spending on medicinal cannabis is surging but scientists say research needs more time to catch up

image.altText: Thorpe walks out of the chamber, a single middle finger raised.

props.synopsis: Labor's Senate leader Penny Wong moved the motion, saying Senator Thorpe's actions had compromised workplace safety in the Senate.

title.children: Lidia Thorpe suspended from Senate for 'gravity of conduct' when she ripped up Pauline Hanson's motion

image.altText: Women welcome people returning to Tyre with smiles on their face

props.synopsis: So far, there has been no signs of violations from Israel and Hezbollah after a ceasefire began at 4am local time in southern Lebanon.

title.children: Displaced people welcomed home across southern Lebanon after ceasefire holds in early stages

image.altText: Musician Marilyn Manson is wearing dark eye makeup and lipstick and a black leather coat

props.synopsis: The rocker is accused by multiple women of sexual and psychological assault, but denies any wrongdoing.

title.children: Marilyn Manson drops lawsuit against former fiancee Evan Rachel Wood

image.altText: Jakara Anthony

props.synopsis: Last season, Jakara Anthony completed one of the all-time great campaigns in snow-sport history. But as the wheel continues to turn towards the next Olympics, the 26-year-old remains focused on an elusive goal.

title.children: Following an 'insane' season jam-packed full of success, Jakara Anthony is still chasing more from her sport

image.altText: Leeroy Bilney

props.synopsis: As SA's Voice to Parliament delivered its historic first speech, some are calling for faith in its ability to create meaningful change. But critics say they are not opposed to axing the body altogether.

title.children: 'We are determined to prove you wrong': South Australia's Voice to Parliament makes first address

image.altText: A drawing of long necked dinosaurs in a leafy scene.

props.synopsis: Using hundreds of samples of fossilised faeces, vomit and intestinal contents, alongside bones and footprints, researchers traced the rise of the dinosaurs over millions of years.

title.children: Fossilised faeces hold clues to how dinosaurs ruled the planet

image.altText: scaffolding around building next to crane

props.synopsis: Urban planners are calling on regional towns to embrace density and learn to love multi-story developments.

title.children: No longer an affordable option for sea and tree changes, planners say regional NSW needs to build up

image.altText: Hannah Green sitting and speaking to media at the Australian Open

props.synopsis: Hannah Green has declared she's at the peak of her powers as the Perth ace strives to snap a decade-long Australian Open title drought for the home hopes.

title.children: In-form Green fires warning to Australian Open field

image.altText: An aerial view of a retirement village surrounded by a body of water. The buildings have matching grey rooves.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will become the first state to force retirement village operators to sign up to a mandatory code of conduct as part of a crackdown on the sector that also includes more transparency on how fees are calculated.

title.children: Victoria cracks down on retirement village operators after ABC investigation

image.altText: A man in a business shirt and tie looks seriously off the camera.

props.synopsis: Counsel assisting the coroner has made final submissions with scathing accusations of former NT police constable Zachary Rolfe, in the inquest into the shooting death of Aboriginal man Kumanjayi Walker.

title.children: Zachary Rolfe allegedly held 'overtly racist attitudes' and 'lied' in court, coroner told

image.altText: A car parked on a beach.

props.synopsis: Residents of Cervantes are being told to evacuate immediately, with a massive fire that was first sparked by a car crash threatening the small fishing town.

title.children: Entire town told to evacuate in massive emergency bushfire north of Perth

image.altText: A young boy playing cricket.

props.synopsis: Australian cricket is booming at junior levels but as the sport attracts a more diverse and higher player base, the pressure on some of these kids is becoming too much and burnout looms.

title.children: 'Sixty overs in a weekend': The parent trap causing burnout in cricket's generation next

image.altText: For sale sign outside an apartment building along a street in Brisbane on October 31, 2018.

props.synopsis: Some first home buyers could find their way into the market sooner under a new federal government scheme. Here's what to know.

title.children: The Help to Buy scheme will bring the dream of home ownership back within reach but it has limits

image.altText: Stock image of a Virgin plane

props.synopsis: A Virgin flight was forced to make an abrupt U-turn over Bass Strait less than half an hour from its destination after missing a runway curfew due to planned upgrade works.

title.children: Virgin flight does U-turn over Bass Strait after missing Hobart airport curfew

image.altText: Three women wearing graduation hats and robes outside a sandstone building at the

props.synopsis: The federal government announced a plan to change the way student debts were indexed months ago. Now the legislation will finally start saving students money.

title.children: HECS changes are finally taking effect. It could mean student debt credits for some — and refunds for others

image.altText: A man stands at a lectern.

props.synopsis: The ABC's chair Kim Williams calls for more investment in the public broadcaster as a counter to the "flood" of online misinformation and disinformation, days after the federal government's decision to abandon legislation that would have forced social media giants to tackle harmful content on their platforms.

title.children: ABC chair warns Australia 'flooded' with misinformation days after government abandons bill to tackle social media content

image.altText: An extreme close up of Angela Merkel with half of her face bathed in sunlight, with the other in darkness

props.synopsis: During her 16 years in office, former German chancellor Angela Merkel served alongside countless world leaders. In her new memoir, she takes aim at Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump.

title.children: Merkel's new memoir details Putin's power games and Trump's antics
